subtitle: These are a delicious chocolatey version of Chelsea buns.

method.text: Preheat oven to 190°C. Lightly grease an 18 cm square cake tin.
Sift the flour into a bowl with the salt and yeast. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Stir in the egg and enough milk to bind to a soft (but not sticky) dough, which leaves the sides of the bowl clean.
Turn out on to a lightly floured surface. Knead lightly until smooth. Cover with a clean tea towel. Leave to prove in a warm place for 1 hour, until doubled in size.
Re-knead the dough lightly on a floured surface. Roll out into a large rectangle measuring 30 x 23 cm.
In a bowl, mix together the chocolates, nuts and sugar. Scatter over the dough, leaving a 2 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cm border around the edges.
Roll up the dough like a Swiss roll, starting at the long end. Press the edges together to seal.
Cut the roll into 12 equal slices. Arrange the slices in the cake tin.
Cover and leave to prove in a warm place for 30 min, until doubled in size.
Place in the oven for 30 min, until well risen and golden. Brush with the honey whilst still hot. Leave to cool slightly in the tin, for approximately 10 min. Turn out the buns and serve warm.

title: Choc and nut buns
